content.text: On the line next to each stopwatch, write the time measured by each student

average time =   .........  \(s\)
What other measurement must be taken in order to be able to calculate the average speed of the trolley?

A slope is made by resting one end of a plank of wood on a block, as shown in Fig
Three students each use a digital stopwatch to time a small trolley rolling down the full length of the slope
The times on their stopwatches as the trolley reached the bottom of the slope are shown in Fig. 1.2
student 1
student 2
student 3
Calculate the distance travelled by the lorry in the first 50 s
Calculate the distance travelled between 50 s and 100 s
Calculate the total distance travelled
A car takes 60 s to travel the distance calculated in **(c)** at a constant speed
Calculate the speed of the car
On Fig. 2.1, draw the speed-time graph for the 60 s at this constant speed
A lorry travels at constant speed for 50 s and then steadily slows down, taking another come to a stop
Fig. 2.1 is the speed-time graph for the 100 s

State one example of a renewable source of energy

State two reasons why it is important that nations investigate energy resources other than fossil fuels (coal, oil, natural gas)

State the reason for your answer to (a)(i)
Fig. 4.1 shows a boy in four positions on a flat floor
How does the pressure of the carbon dioxide compare with atmospheric pressure? Complete the sentence below
The pressure of the carbon dioxide is .................................................... the atmospheric pressure
The atmospheric pressure increases

It diffracts the wave
It does nothing to the wave
It reflects the wave
It refracts the wave

which has the greater boiling point, water or glycerol,
statement
explanation
which has the greater thermal capacity, the water or the glycerol
statement
explanation
A certain mass of water at \(20^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) is heated using a \(30\mathrm{W}\) immersion heater
Initially the temperature rises at \(4^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) per minute
Eventually, the temperature stops rising at \(100^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
The same mass of glycerol at \(20^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) is heated using the same \(30\mathrm{W}\) immersion heater
Initially the temperature rises at \(8^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) per minute
Eventually, the temperature stops rising at \(290^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
State and explain
By what process does thermal energy pass through the metal case of the heater in Fig. 6.1?
State the two main processes by which the thermal energy from the heater is transferred to the whole room
One of the processes in (b)(ii) involves the air moving
On Fig. 6.1, draw arrows to show how the air moves in the room
Fig. 6.1 shows a cross-section through a room
The room is heated by a heater containing hot water. The heater is mounted wall, as shown

The reading on the ammeter is gradually increased

repel
attract

Which is the iron rod?

no effect
An IGCSE Physics student is set a puzzle by his teacher

He is given four rods, A, B, C and D, all painted white. He is told that two rods are permanently magnets, another rod is made of iron and the final rod is made of copper. His teacher asks him to find out, by experiment, which rod is which
Fig. 8.1 shows the results the student obtains when he puts the rods next to each other

current =   .........  A

draw the ray reflected at A,

What four particles together make up an \(\alpha\) -particle?
Suggest one reason why the fact that radon-220 is a gas makes it potentially more dangerous than an \(\alpha\) -emitting solid source of similar activity
Radon-220 is a radioactive gas. It decays by emitting \(\alpha\) -particles. An \(\alpha\) -particle helium nucleus
\(\alpha\) -particles are detected,
only \(\beta\) -particles and \(\gamma\) -rays are detected,
only \(\gamma\) -rays are detected,
\(\alpha\) -particles, \(\beta\) -particles and \(\gamma\) -rays are all detected

In the situations illustrated in Fig. 11.1, the radioactive source is emitting \(\alpha\) -particles, \(\beta\) -particles and \(\gamma\) -rays. The detector is sensitive to all three types of radiation. The apparatus is in air
Ignore background radiation

The interior of the box is lined with thick lead
